author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Asian College of Journalism has instituted awards for investigative journalism. The Media Development Foundation, which administers the institution, has, on its website, called for news organisations and journalists to send in their entries for consideration by the awards committee and jury.

The awards are for investigative journalism in print/online and audio-visual categories and will be presented on May 3, 2016 on World Press Freedom Day. Each award carries a citation and Rs. 2 lakh as prize money. Nominations are open till January 31.

Any journalistic work done by and published/broadcast in newspaper/periodical/website/channel during the calendar year 2015 is eligible for nomination by a news organisation, working or freelance journalist(s). A team of up to five members can be nominated for an award.

Details for nominations can be accessed and uploaded at link: http://bit.ly/1OMt2Ji.

Jurist and author Justice Leila Seth is the chairperson of the awards jury. Senior journalists TJS George and Mrinal Pande and Scholar Mukul Kesavan are the other members.
title: Awards instituted for investigative journalism
